intro: Sisymbrium umbrosum, commonly known as the shadow vetch, is a flowering plant belonging to the Brassicaceae family. It is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, yellow flowers that bloom in early summer. The plant typically grows in shaded, moist environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its leaves are alternate, pinnately lobed, and covered in fine hairs. Sisymbrium umbrosum plays a role in supporting local pollinators and is often found in disturbed or semi-natural habitats.
